body:
$!Default retirement age (formerly 65) has been phased out - most people can now work for as long as they want to.$!

Retirement age is when an employee chooses to retire. Most businesses don't set a compulsory retirement age for their employees. 

If an employee chooses to work longer they [can't be discriminated against](/discrimination-your-rights "Discrimination: your rights").

However, some employers can set a compulsory retirement age if they can clearly justify it.

If an employee is unhappy with their employer's decision, they can challenge this at an [employment tribunal](/employment-tribunals "employment tribunal").

##State Pension age

Retirement age is not the same as State Pension age which can be between 65 and 68, depending when someone was born. Anyone can carry on working past State Pension age.

^Calculate your [State Pension age](/calculate-state-pension "State Pension age calculator").^
overview: Default retirement age has been phased out - most people can work for as long as they want to but some employers can set an compulsory retirement age
title: Retirement age
